original:
The cooperation strategy refers to the coordinated action of multiple muscles when no single muscle can directly exert force in the desired direction of a mechanical action. This approach contrasts with the prime mover strategy, which has seen a decline in popularity. Electromyography studies have indicated that no single muscle consistently generates more force than others involved in joint movement.


The muscle synergy theory faces c
